section.title: Introduction
section.p: This guide will help you getting started with Makumba. It explains the notion of Makumba Data Definitions, and shows you how to make a simple site where you can display and create data.
We'll take the example of a company management site, where you can manage the employees, departments and projects of a company.

section.title: Download
section.p: First of all, download the Makumba template project in order to get an Eclipse WTP project which you can use in order to start working with Makumba.
You'll also need to download Apache Tomcat 5.5 and configure a WTP Server (in Eclipse, go to File -> New -> Other and choose "Server").

Optionally, you can also download MySQL as a database engine. For this introduction however, the template project comes with the HSQLDB database engine, so you don't need to install anything in that regard.

section.title: Describing the data
section.p: Makumba uses so-called Makumba Data Definitions (further described here).

MDDs are simple text files that contain the description of an entity, i.e. its fields but also validation rules and query functions. These files are kept in the dataDefinitions directory in the classpath of the webapp.
Start by creating a new company package in the src/dataDefinitions directory and create the file Employee.mdd with the following content
section.source: name = char[200] surname = char[200] gender = int{"Male" = 10, "Female" = 20} birthdate = date salary = real

body.p: This will make the type company.Employee accessible in the webapp.
body.note: Makumba automatically generates the database schema based on MDDs. If you modify a MDD, you will need to reload your webapp for the changes to be taken into account.

section.title: Entering new data
section.p: Let's make it possible to feed some data to our webapp.
For this, let's create a page that contains a mak:newForm, which enables us to enter new data. Create the file WebContent/employeeNew.jsp with following content:
section.source:
<%@ taglib uri="http://www.makumba.org/presentation" prefix="mak" %> Create new employee record
Name
Surname
Birthdate
Salary
